meanings.definition: A structure built parallel to the bank of a waterway for use as a landing place.
meanings.sent1: The quayside was bustling with people unloading cargo from the ships.
meanings.sent2: The boats were tied up at the quayside, ready for the next journey.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the quayside, eyeing the fish stalls nearby.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the quayside transformed into a peaceful haven for the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves lapping against the quayside was a soothing lullaby.

meanings.sent1: Fishermen gathered at the quayside to share stories of their latest catches.
meanings.sent2: Tourists strolled along the quayside, admiring the view of the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek behind the crates stacked on the quayside.
meanings.sent4: The lights from the ships reflected off the water, creating a magical glow along the quayside.
meanings.sent5: The scent of salt and fish filled the air at the bustling quayside market.
